bugs.title: CVE-2021-33454 yasm: NULL pointer dereference in yasm_expr_get_intnum() in libyasm/expr.c

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-33454 yasm: NULL pointer dereference in yasm_expr_get_intnum() in libyasm/expr.c

long_desc.thetext:
An issue was discovered in yasm version 1.3.0. There is a NULL pointer dereference in yasm_expr_get_intnum() in libyasm/expr.c.

Reference:
https://github.com/yasm/yasm/issues/166

Created yasm tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2122728]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2122729]
Apparently fixed by https://github.com/yasm/yasm/pull/244 (https://github.com/yasm/yasm/commit/9defefae9fbcb6958cddbfa778c1ea8605da8b8b).

Created yasm tracking bugs for this issue:

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of epel-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora EPEL. While
only one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions
at the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each
other, you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=low

# testing, stable

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3

close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

bugs.title: CVE-2023-31975 yasm: memory leak in yasm_intnum_copy() in libyasm/intnum.c

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-31975 yasm: memory leak in yasm_intnum_copy() in libyasm/intnum.c

long_desc.thetext:
yasm v1.3.0 was discovered to contain a memory leak via the function yasm_intnum_copy at /libyasm/intnum.c.

Reference:
https://github.com/yasm/yasm/issues/210

Created yasm tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2208613]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2208612]

This should be rejected as per yasm security policy, unless there's a way this could be exploited using *trusted* input:

https://github.com/yasm/yasm/blob/master/SECURITY.md
Fixed in: https://github.com/yasm/yasm/pull/231/commits/168febbc155c832439be9500452ebe39994d2309 .

https://github.com/yasm/yasm/issues/210

This should be rejected as per yasm security policy, unless there's a way this could be exploited using *trusted* input:

https://github.com/yasm/yasm/blob/master/SECURITY.md

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2208611
